page.title: 03STREET & CATTLE MARKET
page.content:
The street market dates from at least 1086 when it was mentioned in the Domesday Book and has probably been held on a Tuesday for the last 1000 years.
The market is not so important as it used to be, but markets are still held on Tuesdays & Saturdays in the Market Place & nearby streets.
The cattle market is also held on a Tuesday & is the largest in the East Midlands.
Melton Mowbray's early growth was due to its importance as a market centre. Back in the middle of the 19th century Melton Mowbray had five annual fairs.
